image.altText: Firefighters work to extinguish a fire at a house on Russell Island in Queensland.

items.synopsis: Police believe the bodies belong to five young boys and their father reported missing as flames took hold of their home and neighbouring properties on Russell Island, near Brisbane.

title.children: Six bodies found in remains of house fire on Queensland's Russell Island, police say

image.altText: Shane Drumgold holding a folder walking into ACAT.

items.synopsis: The ACT's attorney-general says Shane Drumgold's role as director of public prosecutions is "no longer tenable" and he has accepted his resignation after his handling last year of the investigation into Bruce Lehrmann.

title.children: ACT's top prosecutor resigns after Lehrmann inquiry accuses him of 'serious misconduct'

image.altText: David Spears wearing a dark navy shirt sitting on a chair next to Anthony Albanese wearing a wide brimed hat

items.synopsis: Anthony Albanese tells ABC's Insiders program Indigenous Australians want constitutional recognition and he is not considering any other options if the referendum fails.

title.children: PM warns there will be no other constitutional recognition for Indigenous Australians if Voice fails

image.altText: A graphic illustration shows a woman sitting in front of a prison cell with her head on her knees

items.synopsis: The next frontier of Australia's concussion crisis isn't on the football field, but in homes across the country, where victims of domestic violence are sustaining brain injuries at staggering rates.

title.children: 'One more hit to my head and it would have been game over': The invisible crisis in homes around the country

image.altText: A close up picture of Tracey Price, who is smiling, long straight light brown,blonde hair.

items.synopsis: A lawyer and small business owner will fly the flag for Labor as its mayoral candidate in the 2024 Brisbane City Council election, squaring off against LNP incumbent Adrian Schrinner.

title.children: Labor reveals Brisbane mayoral candidate for March election

image.altText: a queenslander, mid-rise and high-rise in a graphic

items.synopsis: You have to build up to stop building out. But can higher housing density bring about affordability?

title.children: It's one of Australia's fastest growing regions, but can we get past our 'fear of density' to house everyone?

image.altText: A close-up of a corporate pwc logo on a reflective glass building panel.

items.synopsis: Firms and advisers promoting tax exploitation schemes will face hundreds of millions of dollars in penalties as part of what the federal government is calling the biggest crackdown on tax adviser misconduct in Australian history.

title.children: PwC tax scandal prompts government to crack down on tax adviser misconduct

image.altText: People burn incense sticks before praying for the victims of the US 1945 atomic bombing.

items.synopsis: Japan marks the 78th anniversary of the US atomic bombing on Hiroshima, where its mayor urges the abolition of nuclear weapons and calls the Group of Seven leaders' notion of nuclear deterrence a "folly".

title.children: Japan marks 78th anniversary of US atomic bombing on Hiroshima, calls nuclear deterrence 'folly'

image.altText: A man stares out at raging floodwaters in a village.

items.synopsis: A magnitude 5.5 earthquake strikes eastern China as rain continued to pelt the north-eastern regions in the wake of Typhoon Doksuri, adding more pressure to the country's struggle to recover its economy from the COVID pandemic.

title.children: China's economic losses from natural disasters surge to billions, adding more pressure to struggling economy

image.altText: Five men standing and looking at the camera

items.synopsis: The Kinks express their heartbreak over the loss of their former keyboardist, who performed chart topping song Lola.

title.children: The Kinks' ex-keyboardist John Gosling, who played on Lola, dead at 75

image.altText: A man with cap and white beard at a racing stables leans on a fence.

items.synopsis: The Office of Racing Integrity suspends Tasmania's leading greyhound trainer, Anthony Bullock, pending an investigation into conditions at his training facility.

title.children: Concerns for 91 greyhounds on property after trainer suspended pending probe

image.altText: Liam Henry kicks the ball as Hugh McLuggage lunges at him from behind

items.synopsis: Carlton produce an inspired second half performance to beat St Kilda and move to fifth place on the AFL ladder. Follow our live AFL ScoreCentre for all the scores, stats and results.

title.children: AFL live: Dockers testing Lions' top four credentials, Blues storm home to crucial win over Saints

image.altText: Canberra Raiders NRLW players embrace as they celebrate a try against Wests Tigers.

items.synopsis: Canberra records consecutive victories while handing Wests Tigers their first defeat in the NRLW. Earlier, Newcastle convincingly defeated winless Parramatta, who lost Kennedy Cherrington after she was sent from the field in the grand final rematch.

title.children: Raiders end Tigers' unbeaten start to NRLW season, Eels skipper sent off in Knights thrashing

image.altText: A Wests Tigers NRL player holds the ball while being tackled by two Canberra Raiders opponents.

items.synopsis: Canberra's 22-18 victory over the Wests Tigers comes down to a tense final play of the match, while Parramatta celebrates a gritty 26-20 win over St George Illawarra.

title.children: Raiders hold off Tigers in dramatic finish, Eels prevail against Dragons

image.altText: An old coloured photo of moustached man with tattoos on arm, a white vest, painting a window bar white, looks up at camera.

items.synopsis: This man was officially last seen at an Adelaide train station in 1994. But his brother-in-law insists that's not the last he saw of him.

title.children: Steve Lockey had been missing for two years. Then his brother-in-law walked into an outback pub

image.altText: A woman poses in an outdoor area, with a caravan visible in the background.

items.synopsis: Researchers estimate 440,000 older households in Australia will be without suitable housing by 2031. A 56-year-old central Victorian woman is already experiencing the pain.

title.children: A caravan has been Suzi's saviour as organisations shine spotlight on housing for older Australians

image.altText: Older style concrete graves with large headstones and iron fencing set in an area with lawn.

items.synopsis: Death cafes, death doulas, loss podcasts, and alternative funerals and memorials. There's new life in death planning and what we want to happen to our bodies.

title.children: Ashes to diamonds, dust to compost. Dead Air radio host says we need to talk more about new ways to not be alive

image.altText: A smiling man holds a smiling 6-month-old baby

items.synopsis: Baby Afraa survived 10 hours under the rubble after the deadly earthquake that hit Turkey and Syria six months ago killed her family.

title.children: Syrian baby born under earthquake rubble turns six months, happily surrounded by adoptive family

image.altText: A boat with a green hull with Forceful written on it moored near jetty, Brisbane skyline visible behind, light blue skies.

items.synopsis: An iconic Brisbane ship will be taken apart and sold for parts in the coming weeks as maintenance costs mount.

title.children: Last hopes dashed as 98yo tugboat The Forceful heads for the scrap heap

image.altText: An injured Nick Daicos is wearing a Collingwood puffer jacket as he walks off the field with his teammates

items.synopsis: Brownlow Medal favourite Nick Daicos is set to miss six weeks with a knee fracture, sidelining the Collingwood young gun until well into the AFL finals series.

title.children: Brownlow favourite Nick Daicos out for six weeks with fractured knee in blow to Pies' flag hopes

image.altText: A small bird with a reddish beak, black head and grey and white body walks in the sand.

items.synopsis: Exactly what the juvenile bird — dubbed T7 — was up to on his holiday on the NSW North Coast remains a mystery. But conservationists say its epic journey can teach us a lesson on how to better protect the species.

title.children: Scientists stumped by critically endangered hooded plover spotted 850km north of its usual habitat

image.altText: People walk along the beach with a giant cloud of smoke behind them

items.synopsis: As Russia's war in Ukraine hits the 18 month mark, the Crimean Peninsula is becoming both a playground and a battleground again.

title.children: How did Crimea become both a playground and a battleground for Ukraine and Russia?

image.altText: A large group of young men in a park disperse and run away after a smoke bomb goes off in the background

items.synopsis: The online streamer drew thousands of his followers to New York's Union Square, many of them teenagers, with promises of giving away electronics, including a new PlayStation.

title.children: Social media influencer facing charges of inciting riot after thousands cause mayhem in NYC

image.altText: A profile picture of a woman with long dark hair staring seriously at camera

items.synopsis: Growing up in an outback town she was exposed to injustice at an early age and set her sights on fighting for the rights of First Nations people. Now a nominee in the Australian Law Awards, the 36-year-old says Australia has the answers to its crippling incarceration issues.

title.children: Criminal law prodigy Jamie McConnachie blazing a trail in the defence of First Nations people

image.altText: A man wearing a dark blue polo holds up a towel and an IV-fluid bag beside a fire truck.

items.synopsis: The United States' brutal heatwaves are particularly punishing in Arizona, where cacti are suddenly collapsing under extreme temperatures. But one city has found some creative ways to combat the heat.

title.children: Welcome to America's hottest city, where firefighters carry Gatorade and IV fluids on ice

image.altText: Kurt and his partner take selfie sitting on their bikes along a bike path

items.synopsis: With our skies crowded by planes and temperatures currently soaring in Europe, is there a way to travel without ruining the environment?

title.children: How we curbed our carbon footprint while travelling the hot European summer

image.altText: A platypus on a riverbank

items.synopsis: An ecologist says she's surprised the elusive monotremes are surviving so close to residents and urban development.

title.children: Platypuses found in Sydney's Hills District for first time in 25 years

image.altText: A close up shot of some lottery balls.

items.synopsis: You might have heard stories about lottery winners in the US losing a big chunk of their money to taxes. But what are the rules in Australia?

title.children: How much tax do you have to pay for lottery winnings? It depends on what you do with it

image.altText: Main street of Ballarat with snow flakes falling down, people sitting on outdoor cafe tables with heaters, others walking.

items.synopsis: Ballarat, Victoria's third largest city, is notorious for its frosty winters and the near year-round puffer jacket uniform of its residents.

title.children: Does Ballarat deserve its reputation as the coldest city in Victoria? The answer is complex

image.altText: An older woman in a bright yellow jackett and blue beanie smiles at the camera.

items.synopsis: World-record-holder Caroline Campbell, who only started running in her fifties, credits the regular habit with her survival.

title.children: Caroline is running marathons and breaking world records at age 80
